steps.title: Click on the Start button.
steps.content: Click on the Start button.

steps.title: Click on the Settings icon.
steps.content: Click on the Settings icon.

steps.title: In the newly opened Settings dialog, click on the Apps tab.
steps.content: In the newly opened Settings dialog, click on the Apps tab.

steps.title: Click on the Installed Apps.
steps.content: Click on the Installed Apps .

steps.title: Scroll down and select Microsoft OneDrive.
steps.content: Scroll down and select Microsoft OneDrive .

steps.title: Click on the three dots and select the Uninstall option.
steps.content: Click on the three dots and select the Uninstall option.

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+S.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + S . This opens the search bar, typically at the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Type apps & features into the search bar.
steps.content: Type apps & features into the search bar. A list of matching results will appear.

steps.title: Click Apps & Features.
steps.content: Click Apps & Features .

steps.title: Scroll down and select Microsoft OneDrive.
steps.content: Scroll down and select Microsoft OneDrive . You should see two buttons appear beneath this option.

steps.title: Click Uninstall.
steps.content: Click Uninstall . Once the application is removed, it will no longer appear in the list. If prompted to enter a username and password, use the info associated with your Administrator account.

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+i to open the Charms bar.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + i to open the Charms bar. Though OneDrive cannot be completely removed from Windows 8, you can unlink your account to disable the service. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Change PC Settings.
steps.content: Click Change PC Settings .

steps.title: Click OneDrive.
steps.content: Click OneDrive .

steps.title: Click Sync Settings.
steps.content: Click Sync Settings . It’s in the left column. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Slide the “Sync your settings on this PC” switch to Off.
steps.content: Slide the “Sync your settings on this PC” switch to Off. It’s near the top of the main panel.

steps.title: Click File storage.
steps.content: Click File storage . It’s the first option in the left column. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Slide the “Save documents to OneDrive by default” switch to Off.
steps.content: Slide the “Save documents to OneDrive by default” switch to Off. Now that you’ve disabled syncing, it’s safe to unlink your account.

steps.title: Right-click the OneDrive icon in the task bar.
steps.content: Right-click the OneDrive icon in the task bar. It’s the cloud icon near the clock, usually at one of the corners of the desktop. [4] X Research source You may have to click the arrow to view additional icons if you don’t see OneDrive.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings .

steps.title: Click the Account tab.
steps.content: Click the Account tab.

steps.title: Click Unlink this PC.
steps.content: Click Unlink this PC .

steps.title: Click Unlink account.
steps.content: Click Unlink account . This signs you out of your OneDrive account, effectively disabling OneDrive.

steps.title: Click the button.
steps.content: Click the button. It’s usually at the bottom-left corner of the screen. This opens the start menu and the search bar.

steps.title: Type programs into the search bar.
steps.content: Type programs into the search bar. A list of matching results will appear. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click Programs and Features.
steps.content: Click Programs and Features .

steps.title: Scroll down and click Microsoft OneDrive.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Microsoft OneDrive .

steps.title: Click Uninstall.
steps.content: Click Uninstall . Once the application is removed, it will no longer appear in the app list. If prompted to enter a username and password, use the info associated with your Administrator account.
